meanings.definition: To adapt (a story, play, etc.) into a novel.
meanings.sent1: She novelized the classic tale into an exciting book.
meanings.sent2: The author novelized the historical events into a captivating novel.
meanings.sent3: He novelized the mundane daily routine into a thrilling adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination novelized the ordinary world into a magical realm.
meanings.sent5: The writer's skillful storytelling novelized the simple plot into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To make into a novel; fictionalize.
meanings.sent1: They novelized the true story into an intriguing novel.
meanings.sent2: The writer novelized the events of her life into a best-selling book.
meanings.sent3: He novelized the family dinner into a hilarious comedy.
meanings.sent4: Her words novelized the emotions into a vivid story.
meanings.sent5: The author's pen novelized the characters into unforgettable personalities.
